books.title: Russian Folktales
books.author: A. N. Afanasyev
books.summary: A collection of Russian folktales compiled by A. N. Afanasyev, translated and edited by Leonard A. Magnus.

books.title: White Fang
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A wild half-wolf survives a harsh existence before finding love and domestication in civilization.

books.title: The Diary
books.author: Samuel Pepys
books.summary: The diary of a man living in London in the 17th century.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The Secret of the Caves
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: Four boys vacation at nearby caves only to be swept up in a mystery.

books.title: Something New
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Two young writers experience romance and adventure in Lord Emsworth’s Blandings Castle.

books.title: Saint Joan
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Joan of Arc’s life story is retold, from her early life, to her campaigns, and beyond.

books.title: The Charwoman’s Shadow
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A young nobleman becomes a magician to secure his sister’s marriage.

books.title: Kidnapped
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After his parents die, a young Scottish man travels to see his only remaining relative, expecting to be welcomed, but instead finds his life and liberty in grave danger.

books.title: The Three Impostors
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: Two flâneurs in Victorian London get caught up with the members of a secret society and their search for a rare Roman coin.

books.title: Commentaries on the Gallic War
books.author: Julius Caesar
books.summary: Julius Caesar’s account of the conflicts between Rome and Gaul in the later years of the Roman republic.

books.title: The Middle Temple Murder
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: A murder in London’s Middle Temple uncovers a twenty year old conspiracy.

books.title: Table-Talk
books.author: William Hazlitt
books.summary: A collection of essays on art, literature, philosophy, society, and culture.

books.title: The Wealth of Nations
books.author: Adam Smith
books.summary: Adam Smith lays the foundation of classical economics.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.summary: An epic poem following a Greek hero trying to return home after the Trojan war.

books.title: The Mercy of Allah
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: An entrepreneurial businessman satirically relates to his nephews how he became the wealthiest man in Baghdad.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Philip K. Dick
books.summary: A collection of short works by science fiction legend Philip K. Dick.

books.title: The Law of the Four Just Men
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A group of wealthy vigilantes continue their quest to bring justice to those criminals beyond the reach of conventional law.

books.title: The Imitation of Christ
books.author: Thomas à Kempis
books.summary: Thomas à Kempis provides instructions for a Christian spiritual life.

books.title: Through the Brazilian Wilderness
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: Theodore Roosevelt’s autobiographical account of his expedition into the uncharted depths of the Brazilian rainforest.
